Html:
Firstly, thanks so much for this tool - it's made my life SO much easier.

I've got a problem with adding a 'website' source - I get this error message. (Unsupported source type (InternetSite) for source CIA10.)

Am I doing something wrong here??

No.

When implementing a style, I only implement those types that are defined by the style specification. Otherwise, all I would be able to do was implement MY best guess, not necessarely the correct thing. Apparently, formatting rules for websites were not defined when I created the style you are using, hence I didn't include them.

If you have 'official' information on how to format websites for the style, you can always post them here and I will look into it.

On the release page of each style (e.g. http://bibword.codeplex.com/releases/view/22931) there is normally a list of supported types for that specific style.

Thanks for your reply Yves.

I have a book called “ Communication Skills Handbook” by Jane Summers and Brett Smith which was given to us by our University of the Sunshine Coast.

If I scan and email the relevant pages to you, will this be sufficient to update the style sheet?

Regards

Cheryl (abbier)
I have the same problem, is there any solution ?
